intro: Dimeria parva, commonly known as the small dimeria, is a small annual herb native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with simple, lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Dimeria parva is often found in disturbed areas and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
